question_text: Which statement correctly distinguishes Type 1 and Type 2 hypervisors?
answer_options: Type 2 hypervisors run without an OS; Type 1 hypervisors require Windows or Linux
Type 1 hypervisors install only in cloud environments
Type 2 hypervisors run on an existing OS; Type 1 runs directly on hardware
Type 1 hypervisors are less secure than Type 2
correct_answer: Type 2 hypervisors run on an existing OS; Type 1 runs directly on hardware
explanation: Type 1 (bare metal) hypervisors operate directly on physical hardware, while Type 2 hypervisors run atop a host OS.
